Author: dawie
Content: I am not sure. I guess they are just making people aware of it. I wonder if Google is starting to play the PR Game?

Author: dawie
Content: I can't, but I am definately going to get a woman's perspective on my demo.

Author: Alex3917
Content: Well I think you are right too, in the sense that many of the points I mention probably don't overlap much with the challenges that corporate engineers in the industry face on a day-to-day basis. That being said, I think they are still important when considering things from the two guys in a garage perspective.

Author: sbraford
Content:
I know it's trendy to hate on MBAs, but the top schools do crank out some pretty bright talent.

I hear Google has some of these guys answering support email!

Author: RichardPrice
Content:
Apparently the real story was that 45% of European broadband users are using their computers to watch TV online:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/6617013.stm

The TechCrunch headline exaggerates the statistic somewhat.

Author: danw
Content: "Fix RAZR" still needs to be done. Mobile devices need a way to integrate and switch between multiple apps easily before they can progress much further. Copying the 'windows' concept from desktops wont work on such a small screen so there must be a solution. Tabs perhaps?

Author: jsmcgd
Content: Europe is a pretty big place with little consensus on anything. Perhaps you should ask, 'How should you market your Web 2.0 application in the UK?', 'How should you market your your Web 2.0 application in France?' etc etc. The answers may be mostly similar however the differences could be very compelling.

Author: nurall
Content:
So far, I have asked three women whose opinions I trust and there was a marked difference in the response to the quality of the prototype, in comparison to the men's response.

More than anything else, I observed that more importance was given to aesthetics in general by women.

Does this small sample space scale? Can you share your experience?
